In this way, when the consciousness at the end of the karmic formations ceases, it is called cessation.
When the initial consciousness arises, it is called birth.
Great King!
When the karmic formations and consciousness cease, they do not go anywhere;
when the initial consciousness arises, it does not come from anywhere.
Why is this?
Because the nature of consciousness is detached.
Great King!

The karmic formations and consciousness are empty, when they cease, the ceased karmic actions are empty, the initial consciousness is empty, when it arises, the arisen karmic actions are empty, yet the observation of the fruits of karmic actions is not lost.
Great King, you should know!
It is because the initial consciousness continues in a series without interruption that one experiences the fruits of retribution.
At that time, after the Well-Gone One had spoken these words, he spoke a verse, saying:
All are merely names, merely abiding in conceptual discrimination;
Names are discriminated and spoken, yet what is spoken does not exist.
Using various names, various dharmas are spoken of;
Within the dharmas, there are no such dharmas or characteristics of dharmas.
Names and words are empty of names and words, names and words are apart from names and words;
All dharmas are without names and words, yet are spoken of through names and words.
This dharma is not truly existent, it arises through discrimination;
That discrimination also does not exist, emptiness is spoken of through discrimination.
All ordinary beings say that the eye can see forms;
The world falsely discriminates and takes it as real.
The dharma spoken by the Buddha is seen due to the convergence of conditions;
This is the sequence of practice, spoken for the sake of the ultimate truth.
The eye does not see forms, the mind does not perceive dharmas;
This is the ultimate truth, not perceived by the world.
